alert.note: Alert for Pickens (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 11 at 10:47PM CDT until June 11 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Pickens County in west central Alabama... * Until 1145 PM CDT. * At 1047 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bent Oak, or 8 miles southwest of Columbus, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Aliceville, Carrollton, Pickensville, Ethelsville, Memphis, McMullen, Garden, Benevola, Johnston Lake, Bevill Lock And Dam, Gainesville Lake Campground, Dillburg, McShan, George Downer Airport, Owens, Pioneer, Cochrane, Forest and Macedonia. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
